column2: WASHINGTON DMV WRITTEN TEST
column6: WA

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to highway speed, you should:
column4: go to the next entrance ramp.
column6: merge into highway traffic as soon as possible.
column8: stop and wait for a large gap in traffic, then enter the highway and accelerate quickly.

column2: 2. When following motorcycles, drivers should:
column4: keep less space in front of their vehicle.
column6: reduce the minimum following distance.
column8: keep more space in front of their vehicle.
column10: try to pass them as they have different braking capabilities than other motor vehicles.

column2: 3. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must turn into its right lane.
column6: must turn into its left lane.
column8: must go to the next intersection.

column2: 4. Vehicles must be parked within ___  inches of the curb.
5. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column6: Diamond

column2: 6. You must notify the Department of Licensing within _________ of an address change.
column6: 3 weeks

column2: 7. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.
column6: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column8: quickly change speed or lane position.

column2: 8. Aggressive driving includes:
column6: yelling, honking, gesturing at other drivers.
column10: quick lane changes without a signal.

column2: 9. Your red traffic signal changes to green while a pedestrian is crossing in your traffic lane. The right of way should be given:
column6: by the pedestrian, but only when vehicles are turning left.

column2: 10. A vehicle is stopped at a crosswalk to permit a pedestrian to cross the roadway. The driver of the vehicle approaching from the rear should:
column4: overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.
column6: not overtake and pass the stopped vehicle.

column2: 11. A steady yellow light means:
column4: Be prepared to stop for the red light.
column6: Stop, yield the right-of-way, and go.
column8: Be prepared to go. The light will soon be green.

column2: 12. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To decrease the state average speed statistic.
column6: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column10: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.

column2: 13. What is the meaning of red traffic signs?
column6: School ahead.
column10: Stop, do not enter or wrong way.

column2: 14. Bicyclists have the choice to ride on:
column6: the shoulder of a road.
column8: All the other answers are correct.

column2: 15. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column6: there is an intersection ahead.
column8: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 16. The ‘Slower Traffic Keep Right’ sign is used:
column6: at most intersections.

column2: 17. Doing all you can to prevent crashes is called:
column6: ABS Driving

column2: 18. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column6: Regulation signs (regulatory signs)

column2: 19. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.
column6: you may stop to let out passengers.
column8: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column10: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.

column2: 20. If your brakes are wet, you can dry them by:
column6: having them checked by a mechanic.
column8: pull over to the right and wait until it stops raining.

column2: 21. This sign means drivers should:
column6: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column8: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.
column10: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.

column2: 22. When approaching any intersection or driveway, drivers should:
column4: pass other vehicles and then stop.
column6: drive at the fastest speed just before entering the intersection.
column8: look both ways and be ready to stop.

column2: 23. When approaching a highway-rail intersection, the first sign drivers see is usually:
column6: an RXR round sign on a yellow background.

column2: 24. Diamond-shaped signs:
column6: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 25. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.
column6: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 26. What should you do in case of a brake failure?
column4: Pull off the road into an open space, if available.
column6: All of the above.
column8: Rub your tires on the curb to slow your car.

column2: 27. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column10: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 28. Where must a pedestrian walk when there are no sidewalks?
column4: On the left side of the road, behind slower vehicles.
column6: On the side of the road, facing the traffic.
column8: On the side of the road, in the same direction of traffic.
column10: In the middle of the road, facing oncoming traffic.

column2: 29. Your body gets rid of ____ alcoholic drink an hour.
column6: one

column2: 30. When you drive near parks and playgrounds, you should expect children:
column4: to stop at the curb before crossing the street.
column6: to know when it is safe to cross.
column8: not to cross unless they are with an adult.
column10: to suddenly run into the street.

column2: 31. When driving in heavy rain, drivers should use:
column6: emergency flashers.

column2: 32. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column6: must enter the roadway immediately.
column8: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column10: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 33. If a broken yellow line is on your side of the center line:
column4: you are driving in the left lane.
column6: you have the right-of-way when turning left.
column8: you may not pass other vehicles.
column10: you may cross the line to pass other vehicles.

column2: 34. This sign means:
column4: The lane ahead is reserved for bicycles.
column6: Warning: a bikeway crosses the roadway ahead.
column10: Bicycles should yield to vehicles ahead.

column2: 35. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
column6: School crossing

column2: 36. To drive defensively, you must:
column4: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.
column6: avoid scanning the road ahead.
column10: keep one hand on the steering wheel.

column2: 37. A broken white line:
column4: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.
column6: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column8: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.

column2: 38. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column6: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column10: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 39. Road signs that direct drivers to services are:
column6: blue and white.

column2: 40. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.
